Michael Paulukonis  Framingham, MA 0170 | 857.245.9403 | michael.paulukonis@gmail.com | linkedin.com/in/michaelpaulukonis  michaelpaulukonis.github.io | github.com/MichaelPaulukonis  Senior Software Engineer  Senior Software Engineer specializing in backend systems, microservices, and cloud infrastructure. I build scalable APIs and serverless applications using Node.js, TypeScript, and AWS, with experience stabilizing complex codebases and implementing automated testing practices. I work across the product lifecycle—from requirements analysis through deployment—and bridge technical and business needs effectively. Currently expanding my skills in generative AI and machine learning.  Technical Skills  Primary:   Node.js | JavaScript | TypeScript | AWS | SQL | Visual Studio Code | MacOS | Documentation | Prompt Engineering | Requirements and Specifications | Refactoring | Unit Testing  Familiar:   Accessibility | Bootstrap | CI/CD | Chai | Cognito | Cypress | Docker | DynamoDB | ESLint | Gemini-CLI | Generative AI | Git | Github Copilot | Heroku | JSON | Linux | Machine Learning | Mocha | MongoDB | NPM | Natural Language Processing | NoSql | Nx | OpenSearch | P5JS | PHP | Playwright | PostgreSQL | Python | REST API development | React | S3 | Sinon | Swagger/OpenAPI | Terraform | Testing and QA | Twilio | Vercel | VueJs | XML  Core Competencies  Software Development | Javascript | Requirements Analysis  Software Project Management | Software Documentation | Testing  Professional Experience  Travelers,   Hartford, CT   December 2017-May 2025  Senior Engineer (Full-time)  ●   Developed new insurance tech product on a 5-person innovation team, delivering MVP to production in under 6 months. Built scalable microservices using Javascript ES6 (Node.js/TypeScript), Vue.js, AWS Lambda, API Gateway, Cognito, and S3, with CI/CD pipelines managed via Jenkins, GitLab, and Urban Code Deploy.  ●   Led backend development of a serverless, cloud-native voice solution using Twilio and AWS Lambda, demonstrating the viability of fully serverless customer engagement.  ●   Designed and built a reusable notification system that integrates Mandrill with internal APIs, enabling standardized, template-based communication patterns across product teams.  ●   Championed automated testing culture across the team: implemented backend test coverage with Mocha, Chai, and Sinon; frontend E2E with Cypress and Playwright; and balanced test coverage with delivery velocity.  ●   Practiced and promoted RESTful API design principles within a distributed microservices architecture deployed across AWS and Pivotal Cloud Foundry — including services leveraging DynamoDB, RDS, SNS/SQS, CloudWatch, EventBridge, IAM, and VPC
configurations.  ●   Contributed to infrastructure automation and deployment using Terraform, supporting infrastructure-as-code patterns within multi-environment pipelines.  ●   Mentored junior engineers and wrote team onboarding guides, accelerating ramp-up for new hires and fostering team continuity.  ●   Recognized as an innovator with inclusion on patent (US11,132,565B2, Sep.28,2021) for "SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) DRIVING ANALYSIS AND INCENTIVES"  Insurity,   Hartford, CT   June 2014–Dec 2017  Senior Software Engineer  ●   Team-lead and development owner for forms collaborative development tool. Cloud-based technology (MVC, C#, Javascript, Entity Framework) supporting internal and external customers on mission critical components for forms configuration with their Policy product.  ●   Effectively delivered tool enhancements and efficiencies by leading development estimation and work prioritization across developers and business owners. Set technology direction, team practices, and coding standards.  ●   Re-engineered the codebase to modernize the architecture and stabilize the application. Introduced unit testing for both C# (NUnit) and Javascript (QUnit) components to facilitate application testing.  ●   Worked with DevOps to facilitate product builds and distribution practices across internal and external data centers. Acted as the release manager for all product updates, setting schedules and ensuring full functional testing was complete.  ●   Cleaned and migrated 20 years of data, exposing and helping to correct over 10,000 data integrity issues.  ●   Developed and automated reports.  Westbrook Technologies/Docuware,   Branford, CT   February 2011–June 2014  Consulting Engineer (Professional Services)  ●   Developed custom systems integration solutions of company’s document management products and clients' legacy systems (using C#, VB, ASP.NET, JavaScript, SQL) for desktop, server and web.  ●   Analyzed customer needs, including processes, frameworks, interfaces, and other components. Transferred those needs into functional and technical specifications. Design, develop and implement the custom solution.  ●   Installed products, configured systems, and conducted troubleshooting.  ●   Worked closely with partners and clients throughout the software life-cycle.  ●   Saved customer cloud-storage fees by creation of middleware allowing integrated Salesforce access to a terabyte of customer-hosted documents.  Freelance Programmer   2009–present  ●   PolychromeText (2013-2025): Created and maintained a visual poetry web application using p5.js and Nuxt.js where users create colorful text art through mouse interaction. Recently upgraded from Nuxt 2 to Nuxt 3 using Gemini-CLI, implemented high-resolution rendering, and refactored a 2000-line file into modular components under 600 lines using GitHub Copilot assistance.
●   Project lead and developer (JavaScript and XUL) of   SkipScreen , a FireFox extension that  automated user experience on selected websites (2009-2011).  ●   One of the top downloaded FireFox extensions on addons.mozilla.org in August 2010, over 3.5 million downloads with over 500,000 daily users.  ●   Built Bootstrap skin for PmWiki (PHP, CSS, Javascript).  ●   Developed wiki-based CMS for technical documentation at a large pinball manufacturer.  ●   Added accessibility features and updated e-commerce plugin for wiki used by state association of the blind; used HTML, PHP, CSS.  ●   Created Twitter and Tumblr bots using Node.js and Heroku.  Education  Python for Data Science and Machine Learning Bootcamp  Udemy, Expected November 2025  Generative AI for Software Development  DeepLearning.AI (Coursera), June 2025  Coursework towards a Master of Science (MS) in Software Engineering  University of Scranton, Scranton, PA  Undergraduate coursework in Computer Science  University of Scranton, Scranton, PA  Bachelor of Arts (BA) in English  St. John's University, Collegeville, MN  Awards & Honors  Upsilon Pi Epsilon - honor society for the computing sciences (2010)  Contributor to patent (US11,132,565B2, Sept. 28, 2021) for "SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) DRIVING ANALYSIS AND INCENTIVES"

Senior Software Engineer


Senior Software Engineer who excels at building complex microservices, APIs, and full-stack solutions with AWS infrastructure and JavaScript expertise. I transform troubled codebases into stable systems while sharing knowledge across the product lifecycle. My strengths include quality code delivery, bridging technical and business needs, and growing skills in creative coding and machine learning. Expert in Node.js, Vue.js, and AWS. Previous expertise includes .NET, Windows and OSX, I manage feature development from concept through successful deployment.


Technical Skills


Primary: Node.js | JavaScript | TypeScript | AWS | VueJs | C# | ASP.NET | SQL | Visual Studio Code | Visual Studio | Windows | OSX | Documentation | Prompt Engineering | Requirements and Specifications | Refactoring | Unit Testing


Familiar: Accessibility | API development | Bootstrap | Bots | Chai | CI/CD | Cypress | Docker | DynamoDB | Emacs | ESLint | Generative AI | Git | Heroku | Java | JSON | Linux | Machine Learning | Mocha | MongoDB | MS Copilot | Natural Language Processing | NoSql | NPM | NUnit | OpenSearch | P5JS | PHP | Python | React | Regular Expressions | Retrieval Augmented Generation | Sinon | Splunk | Swagger/OpenAPI | Terraform | Testing and QA | Twilio | Vercel | Web API | XML


Core Competencies


Software Development | Javascript | Full Stack | Requirements Analysis
Software Project Management | Software Documentation | Testing


Professional Experience


Travelers, Hartford, CT        December 2017-May 2025
Senior Engineer (Full-time)
Senior Architect (Full-time)
Senior Architect (Contractor)
* Developed new insurance tech product on 5-person innovation team, delivering from concept to market in under 6 months using Node.js, Typescript, Vue.js, Git, Twilio, and AWS services (Lambda, API Gateway, S3, Cognito). Built microservices architecture with serverless components, implemented CI/CD pipelines, and used agile practices.
* Built one of the company's first cloud-native phone solutions using Twilio and AWS Lambda, demonstrating the viability of serverless architecture for customer interactions.
* Designed and implemented a flexible notification system connecting Mandrill with existing services, creating a new team pattern for template-based customer communications.
* Established testing best practices for innovation projects using Mocha, Chai, Sinon and Cypress, balancing speed of development with code quality.
* Worked with Microservices Architecture with Pivotal Cloud Foundry and AWS (API Gateway, Cloudwatch, EC2, EventBridge, Lambda, RDS, S3, SNS, SQS, etc.).
* Recognized as an innovator with inclusion on patent patent (US11,132,565B2, Sep.28,2021) for "SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) DRIVING ANALYSIS AND INCENTIVES"


Insurity, Hartford, CT         June 2014–Dec 2017
Senior Software Engineer
* Team-lead and development owner for forms collaborative development tool. Cloud-based technology (MVC, C#, Javascript, Entity Framework) supporting internal and external customers on mission critical components for forms configuration with their Policy product.
* Effectively delivered tool enhancements and efficiencies by leading development estimation and work prioritization across developers and business owners. Set technology direction, team practices, and coding standards.
* Re-engineered the codebase to modernize the architecture and stabilize the application. Introduced unit testing for both C# (NUnit) and Javascript (QUnit) components to facilitate application testing.
* Worked with DevOps to facilitate product builds and distribution practices across internal and external data centers. Acted as the release manager for all product updates, setting schedules and ensuring full functional testing was complete.
* Cleaned and migrated 20 years of data, exposing and helping to correct over 10,000 data integrity issues.
* Developed and automated reports.


Westbrook Technologies/Docuware, Branford, CT         February 2011–June 2014
Consulting Engineer (Professional Services)
* Developed custom systems integration solutions of company’s document management products and clients' legacy systems (using C#, VB, ASP.NET, JavaScript, SQL) for desktop, server and web.
* Analyzed customer needs, including processes, frameworks, interfaces, and other components. Transferred those needs into functional and technical specifications. Design, develop and implement the custom solution.
* Installed products, configured systems, and conducted troubleshooting.
* Worked closely with partners and clients throughout the software life-cycle.
* Saved customer cloud-storage fees by creation of middleware allowing integrated Salesforce access to a terabyte of customer-hosted documents.


Freelance Programmer        2009–present
* Project lead and developer (JavaScript and XUL) of SkipScreen, a FireFox extension that automated user experience on selected websites (2009-2011).
* One of the top downloaded FireFox extensions on addons.mozilla.org in August 2010,over 3.5 million downloads with over 500,000 daily users.
* Built Bootstrap skin for PmWiki (PHP, CSS, Javascript).
* Developed wiki-based CMS for technical documentation at a large pinball manufacturer.
* Added accessibility features and updated e-commerce plugin for wiki used by state association of the blind; used HTML, PHP, CSS.
* Created Twitter and Tumblr bots using Node.js and Heroku and NPM packages.




Education




Coursework towards a Master of Science (MS) in Software Engineering
University of Scranton, Scranton, PA


Undergraduate coursework in Computer Science
University of Scranton, Scranton, PA


Bachelor of Arts (BA) in English
St. John's University, Collegeville, MN


Currently pursuing online coursework in 'Python for Data Science and Machine Learning Bootcamp'
Udemy




Awards & Honors


Upsilon Pi Epsilon - honor society for the computing sciences (2010)


Contributor to patent (US11,132,565B2, Sept. 28, 2021) for "SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) DRIVING ANALYSIS AND INCENTIVES"
